page.title: 07Leisure in Great Coxwell
page.content: There is a garden fete each summer in aid of St.Giles' Church.Programmes of Folk Music,Christmas Carols and an auction have been held in the Tithe Barn in aid of the Church Restoration Fund.The Womens' Institute has arrang- ed 6 parties in a marquee,the Reading room and members' homes,plus 3 coffee mornings & 3 barbecues,one of which celebrated Prince Charles'Wedding.They have also organised classes for canvas work & this year completed a patchwork quilt.In 1980 they planted a tree to commemorate the Queen Mother's 80th birthday.For several years one resid- ent has run Art Classes and another a Guy Fawkes bonfire party.Each summer the Conservative Association has held a party in members' gardens.There is an occasional Fox Hunt and Shoot.A Cross Country Event for teams of 4 horses is held annually.
